result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. JOHN R. SAMMER

records.addlTxt:
8:51 AM Defendant JOHN R. SAMMER appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Lim in court for JOHN R. SAMMER.  Prosecuting attorney Christian A. Gossett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court is in compliance with Marsy's Law/Victim Rights.   Address/phone number verified - no change.  Bond Continues.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No contact with V1 in 22-34901 or the 900 BL of Greenwood Ct in Oshkosh. Defendant does acknowledge they've been advised who the victim(s) is/are. May pick up belongings one time accompanied by police escort once 72 hour no contact is no longer in effect, provided there are no other court orders prohibiting contact.

3:05 PM Defendant JOHN R. SAMMER appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brianne Eileen Patzer appeared by video for JOHN R. SAMMER.  Prosecuting attorney Amanda Nash in court for the State of Wisconsin. Given/has complaint. Waive reading. Advised of rights. The defendant authorized the Court to send text message reminders of upcoming court hearings. The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law. The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement. Record closed @ 311
faxed to Sheriff's Office for handout to DE with their copy of the criminal complaint.
